title: Ultrasound-Based Anatomy Education: Practice-Centered Learning for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-Level Understanding of Basic Anatomy and Human Body Structures
context.additional_context: A program designed for pre-service teachers to enhance anatomical knowledge using ultrasound technology and acquire practical, real-life-applicable teaching methods.

learning_goals: Accurately identify and describe the three-dimensional structure and cross-sections of the human body using ultrasound imaging.
Observe and document physiological characteristics of specific anatomical regions using ultrasound devices during dissection practice.
Analytically evaluate the impact of ultrasound-based learning experiences on the applicability of anatomy education in real-world settings.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
